snippet: Giant crocodiles, far larger than any known to date, lived in Kenya two million to four million years ago among our human ancestors, according to a new report.
abstract: Dr Christopher A Brochu study in The Journal of Vertebrate Paleontology identifies giant prehistoric crocodile that lived in Kenya over two million years ago, among human ancestors; ancient species is not closely related to the modern Nile crocodile. Photo (M)5
lead_paragraph: Giant crocodiles, far larger than any known to date, lived in Kenya two million to four million years ago among our human ancestors, according to a new report. A fossil of one specimen, 27 feet in length, shows that it is not closely related to the Nile crocodile, as some scientists had thought, said Christopher A. Brochu, a vertebrate paleontologist at the University of Iowa and the new study's first author.

headline.main: A Crocodile Too Huge To Fit on the Family Tree
